item.name: Dog
item.infoText: The present lineage of dogs was domesticated from gray wolves about 15,000 years ago. Remains of domesticated dogs have been found in Siberia and Belgium from about 33,000 years ago

item.name: Cat
item.infoText: Cats are similar in anatomy to the other felids, with strong, flexible bodies, quick reflexes, sharp retractable claws, and teeth adapted to killing small prey.

item.name: Horse
item.infoText: The horse has evolved over the past 45 to 55 million years from a small multi-toed creature into the large, single-toed animal of today.

item.name: Panda
item.infoText: The giant panda lives in a few mountain ranges in central China, mainly in Sichuan province, but also in the Shaanxi and Gansu provinces.

item.name: Tiger
item.infoText: The tiger (Panthera tigris) is the largest cat species, reaching a total body length of up to 3.3 metres (11 ft) and weighing up to 306 kg (670 lb).
